qas.question: Who was at the dying pope's bedside?
Who was the Papal Sacristan for John XXIII?
When did the pope bid farewell?
What kind of family was Petrus Canisius Van Lierde born into?

plausible_answers.text: But Christ lives on and continues his work in the Church

qas.question: What did Van Lierde mention about the work of the church?

plausible_answers.text: forgot the right order of anointing

qas.question: What did John XXIII forget to do when he was overcome with emotion?
When did Van Lierde give everyone a last farewell?

plausible_answers.text: his eyes, ears, mouth, hands and feet

qas.question: What was annointed by John XXIII?

context: "<b6_0>At <a2_0>11 am<b6_0/><a2_0/> <a0_0><a1_0>Petrus Canisius Van Lierde<a1_0/><a0_0/> as Papal Sacristan was at the bedside of the dying pope, ready to anoint him. The pope began to speak for the very last time: "I had the great grace to be born into a <b3_0>Christian<b3_0/> family, modest and poor, but with the fear of the Lord. My time on earth is drawing to a close. <b4_0>But Christ lives on and continues his work in the Church<b4_0/>. Souls, souls, ut omnes unum sint."[c] Van Lierde then anointed <b7_0>his eyes, ears, mouth, hands and feet<b7_0/>. Overcome by emotion, Van Lierde <b5_0>forgot the right order of anointing<b5_0/>. John XXIII gently helped him before bidding those present a last farewell.
